subject: Technology
title: Reality TV: Cheap, Addictive, Everywhere
description: One-minute skill: Reality TV: Cheap, Addictive, Everywhere.

hook.text: Put strangers in a house, film them 24/7, and let the audience vote someone out each week. It's not art, but it's addictive.

buildup.text: Survivor and Big Brother launched in 2000 and proved that unscripted drama with real people attracted enormous audiences.

discovery.text: Reality TV costs a fraction of scripted shows. No actors, no writers, no expensive sets. Just cameras and conflict.

twist.text: Reality TV isn't real. Producers manipulate situations, edit scenes out of order, and manufacture drama from nothing.

climax.text: Reality TV now dominates programming worldwide. From cooking shows to dating competitions, the format is endlessly adaptable.

punchline.text: Reality TV is the cheapest content to make and the hardest to stop watching.

quiz.question: Why do networks love reality TV?
options: It costs far less to produce than scripted shows
